#Text=Aracataca
#Text=Aracataca
#Text=is a small town in the Magdalena Department of Colombia , to the south of Santa Marta .
#Text=Largely unknown to travelers and even to the guidebooks , this town absolutely should not be overlooked in the itinerary of anyone with any interest in Gabriel García Márquez .

#Text=In addition to being his birthplace , it was the inspiration for the fictional aldea Macondo , and has a great deal of monuments and sites of interest related to 100 Years of Solitude and other works .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Imagine 200 years ago , walking all around the tropical Colombian swamp and forests searching for a way towards the sea , to be free of corrupt civilizations and to start your own .
#Text=To discover a river and a beautiful and fertile land .
#Text=Tired of traveling you decide that this is the place where you want to settle and raise a family .

#Text=This happened to Jose Arcadio Buendía and his wife Ursula in Gabriel Garcia Marquez ’s masterpiece 100 Years of Solitude when those free souls with their friends founded Macondo , the imaginary town that " does not exist " .

#Text=The early 21st century , the whole world has changed , Colombia became a melting pot for many of the world ’s peoples , and amidst the oldest cities of the continent and the most astonishing nature in the world , Macondo ’s entrance is still invisible for mass tourism yet Aracataca is a real adventurers ’ gem .
#Text=Get in

#Text=Downtown Aracataca ; from the Santa Marta terminal you take the bus to Aracataca ( COP$ 9,000 , 1½ hours ) , you get out in the center and take a ciclotaxi ( COP$ 1,000 per person ) to wherever you need to go .
#Text=From Bogota you get out in Aracataca ( COP$ 70,000 ) at the vuelta del torrito and you ’ll take a mototaxi to wherever you need to go .
#Text=Get around
#Text=To get around is pretty simple , there are bicycle taxis that take you to the most important places for about COP$ 1,000 a person .

#Text=If you 'd rather see everything going around on your own bike there are guided bicycle tours that take you , for about 2 hours along the most important sights in town while explaining about the rich histories .
#Text=Tours are for sale at the Gypsy Residence .
#Text=Eat
#Text=There are several good restaurants in town that serve local Macondonian foods , between them Restaurant Gabo and restaurant Donde Memo .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Gypsy Residence
#Text=, ☏ +573212517420 , ✉ info@thegypsyresidence.com . two double bedrooms and one 6-bed dormitory , a terrace , and a garden .
#Text=+57 3015933691 COP$ 20,000 a bed , COP$ 60,000 for a double bedroom .
